topic.title: Development mode
topic.p: Ktor provides a special mode targeted for development. This mode enables the following capabilities:

list.li: Auto-reload for reloading application classes without restarting the server.
Extended information for debugging pipelines (with stack traces).
Extended debugging information on a response page in a case of a 5** server error.

note.p: Note that development mode affects performance and shouldn't be used in production.

chapter.title: Enable development mode
chapter.p: You can enable development mode in different ways: in the application configuration file, using a dedicated system property, or environment variable.

chapter.title: Configuration file
chapter.p: To enable development mode in a configuration file, set the development option to true:

chapter.title: The 'io.ktor.development' system property
chapter.p: The io.ktor.development system property allows you to enable development mode when running your application:

li.p: To run an application in development mode using IntelliJ IDEA, pass io.ktor.development with the -D flag to VM options:
If you run your application using a Gradle task, you can pass io.ktor.development to the applicationDefaultJvmArgs property in a build.gradle(.kts) file:

tip.p: You can also use the -ea flag to enable development mode. Note that the io.ktor.development system property passed with the -D flag takes precedence over -ea.

chapter.title: The 'io.ktor.development' environment variable
chapter.p: To enable development mode for a Native client, use the io.ktor.development environment variable.
